abstract: A competition among journalism students for seed money shows that Web services like AdSense, Facebook and Ning may make it much easier to start a publication than ever before.
snippet: A competition among journalism students for seed money shows that Web services like AdSense, Facebook and Ning may make it much easier to start a publication than ever before.
lead_paragraph: Every now and then, I meet someone idealistic and perhaps foolish enough to want to embark on a career in journalism. Until recently, my advice was largely the same as anyone had given for many decades: Find a gig where you can write — a small town paper, freelancing for an alternative weekly, a business trade publication (my route). If you’re good, the story went, you would find you way to bigger publications and forge a career.

headline.main: Entrepreneurial Journalism in the Facebook Age
